message.content:
cs.CL, cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV

Reasoning: 

1. cs.CL (Computation and Language) - This paper discusses recent findings from Linguistics regarding the organization of conversation in turns, adjacent pairs, (dis)preferred responses, (self)repairs, etc. and proposes an abstract algorithm that describes how a machine can implement a double-feedback system that can reproduce a human-like face-to-face interaction by processing various signs, such as verbal, prosodic, facial expressions, gestures, etc. This suggests that the paper is related to natural language processing and computational linguistics, which fall under the cs.CL category.

2. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) - The paper discusses guidelines for designing man-machine multimodal interfaces that can reproduce human-like face-to-face interactions. This suggests that the paper is related to human-computer interaction, which falls under the cs.HC category.

3. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - The paper proposes an abstract algorithm that describes how a machine can implement a double-feedback system that can reproduce a human-like face-to-face interaction. This suggests that the paper is related to artificial intelligence, which falls under the cs.AI category.

4. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper proposes an abstract algorithm that describes how a machine can implement a double-feedback system that can reproduce a human-like face-to-face interaction. This suggests that the paper is related to machine learning, which falls under the cs
